page.title: 12MEANWOOD VALLEY TRAIL- LEEDS
page.content: MEANWOOD VALLEY TRAIL has been created to enable city dwellers to appreciate the countryside within the city.The Trail links parks and public rights of way in a 7 mile linear route. The trail is well marked.It is divided into 4 stages and can be joined or left at any stage.The route runs from Woodhouse Moor to Golden Acre Park. There are special wardens who organise various events for enjoyment and education.Among these are the "Dawn Chorus"Walk to look at the birds at the height of bird song and nesting activity;"Spring Moth Watch";a talk entitled" Meanwood Village Past and Present;lectures on the wild flowers of the area, its industrial heritage and, ofocurse, the wardens work in conservation.
